content:
Great! Yaizu City has wonderful shopping options for local products. You can find fresh seafood, local agricultural products, souvenirs, and traditional items.

Here are some popular shopping destinations:

**Seafood & Local Specialties:**
- **ã‚„ã„ã¥ã¨ãã•ã‚“ãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¶** (Yaizu Tokusan Plaza) - Located in ã†ã¿ãˆï½ã‚‹ç„¼æ´¥, this shop offers dried bonito, bonito flakes, tuna products, local processed seafood, and character goods. Open 9:00-17:30 (closed Jan 1-3).
- **ãƒ¤ã‚¤ãƒ…ãƒ„ãƒŠã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ—** (Yaizu Tuna Coop) - Fresh tuna and local processed products at ã†ã¿ãˆï½ã‚‹ç„¼æ´¥. Open 8:00-17:00 (closed Mondays and Jan 1-5).

**Fresh Produce & Local Goods:**
- **ã¾ã‚“ã•ã„ã‹ã‚“ç„¼æ´¥** (Mansaikan Yaizu) - Farmers market with fresh vegetables, meat, rice, and local products. Open 9:00-17:00.
- **ã¾ã‚“ã•ã„ã‹ã‚“é™æµœ** (Mansaikan Shizuhama) - Fresh vegetables, fruits, and handmade processed items. Open 9:00-17:00.

**Traditional Products:**
- **ã¬ã‹ã‚„æ–è—¤å•†åº—** (Nukaya Saito Shoten) - Traditional ãªã¾ã‚Šç¯€ (nama-ri bushi) and other fish products in a historic building. Open 10:30-17:00.

What would you like to know more about â€” the hot spring experience, dining options, or how to book?

Hotel Ambia Shofukaku is Yaizu's premier resort hotel, perfectly suited for couples! It sits dramatically on an 80-meter cliff overlooking Suruga Bay with stunning views of Mount Fuji.

**Main Features:**

ğŸ¨ **Location & Views**
- All rooms have ocean views
- Beautiful Suruga Bay and Mount Fuji visible from the hotel
- On clear days, you can see the Izu Peninsula too

â™¨ï¸ **Hot Spring (Onsen)**
- Men's bath: "Shibuki no Yu" / Women's bath: "Nagisa no Yu"
- Open-air bath with views of Suruga Bay
- Salt chloride spring from 1,500 meters underground
- Great for relieving fatigue and skin care
- Day-trip bathing available (Â¥1,100 with towel)

ğŸ½ï¸ **Kaiseki Restaurant "Misaki"**
- Authentic Japanese kaiseki cuisine using fresh local seafood from Yaizu
- Table seating and private rooms (up to 12 people)
- Available for day-trippers too
- Lunch: 11:30â€“14:00 / Dinner: 17:30â€“20:30

ğŸ­ **Dinner Show**
- Regular entertainment performances
- Day-trip participation available
- Ticket purchase by phone only

**Basic Information:**
- Address: 1541 Hamataome, Yaizu City, Shizuoka 425-0012
- Phone: 054-628-3131
- Website: [https://www.syofukaku.com/](https://www.syofukaku.com/)

**Access:**
- By car: ~10 min from Tomei Yaizu IC / ~20 min from Shin-Tomei Yaizu Okabe IC
- By train: Free shuttle bus from JR Yaizu Station South Exit (Platform 5) â€” runs 7:00 AMâ€“7:00 PM every 30 minutes, no reservation needed
Would you like to know about other romantic spots or activities in Yaizu to combine with your hotel visit?

Hotel Ambia Shofukaku offers wonderful day-trip options perfect for couples!

**Day-Trip Facilities Available:**

â™¨ï¸ **Hot Spring Bath (Day-trip)**

- Men's bath: "Shibuki no Yu" / Women's bath: "Nagisa no Yu"
- Open-air bath with Suruga Bay views
- Relax while enjoying the ocean scenery and Mount Fuji views

ğŸ½ï¸ **Kaiseki Lunch at Restaurant "Misaki"**
- Authentic Japanese kaiseki using fresh local Yaizu seafood
- Lunch time: 11:30â€“14:00
- Available for day-trippers
- Perfect for a special couple's meal

ğŸ­ **Dinner Show**
- Evening entertainment performances
- Day-trip participation available
- Tickets must be purchased by phone: 054-628-3131

**Recommended Day-Trip Plan:**
Combine a hot spring bath with lunch or dinner at the restaurant for a relaxing, romantic experience without staying overnight!

**Contact for Reservations:**

conversation_title: Finding Coupons for Stores or Restaurants
content:
I'd be happy to help you find information about coupons in Yaizu City!

Currently, there is a **Digital Coupon Festival** running from **January 24-30, 2026** in Yaizu City. Here's how to access the coupons:

## How to Get the Coupons

**Step 1: Add Yaizu City Official LINE**
Register as a friend on the [Yaizu City Official LINE](https://line.me/R/ti/p/@vgn0514a?from=page)

**Step 2: Complete Reception Settings**
1. Tap the **gear icon "Reception Settings"** in the bottom right of the basic menu
2. Tap **"Set Here"** under "Basic Reception Settings"
3. Answer the survey questions that appear
4. Tap **"Confirm"** at the bottom
5. Tap **"Send"** on the confirmation screen

Once you complete these settings, a menu to retrieve coupons will be sent to your LINE chat.

**Step 3: Use at Stores**
1. Tap **"Present Coupon"** at the bottom of the coupon screen in front of store staff
2. The button will change to **"Mark as Used"** â€” tap it again
3. Confirm the message asking "Mark as used?" and tap **"Mark as Used"**
4. Verify the coupon shows as **"Used"** and proceed to payment

## Coupon Details

- **500 yen discount**: Available for purchases of Â¥1,000 or more
- **1,000 yen discount**: Available for purchases of Â¥2,000 or more
- **Usage**: One coupon per store, up to 2 stores total

The coupons are valid at 52 participating stores throughout Yaizu City.

conversation_title: Walking Suggestions After Visiting Yaizu Fish Market
content:
Based on a 45-minute walk from Yaizu Sakana Center toward the port, here's what you can explore:

**Recommended Walking Route:**

Starting from Yaizu Sakana Center, head toward the harbor area. You'll pass through the port district and can enjoy views of the fishing boats and harbor atmosphere. The walk will take you through the working waterfront where you can see the active fishing industry that makes Yaizu famous.

Along the way, you can visit:
- **Old Yaizu Port (æ—§ç„¼æ´¥æ¸¯)** - A scenic spot with views of Mount Fuji
- **New Yaizu Port (æ–°ç„¼æ´¥æ¸¯)** - Another viewpoint of the harbor

The port area offers authentic harbor town scenery and is a great way to experience Yaizu's fishing heritage firsthand. You'll see the daily activities of this important fishing community.

**Note:** For more detailed information about specific facilities or attractions along this route, I'd recommend checking the official model course map:
<https://www.city.yaizu.lg.jp/documents/13409/01yaizukou_fuji.pdf>

content: Will Koizumi Yakumo be introduced in Bakebake in Yaizuï¼Ÿ

conversation_title: Inquiry About Koizumi Yakumo's Presence in Bakebake, Yaizu
content:
Based on the information available, yes, Koizumi Yakumo (å°æ³‰å…«é›²) will be featured in the upcoming NHK asadora "Bakebake" (ã°ã‘ã°ã‘).

Here are the key details:

**Connection to Yaizu:**
- The series, set to air in autumn 2025, features Koizumi Yakumo and his wife Setsu as central figures
- The protagonist, Matsuno Toki, is modeled after Setsu, Yakumo's wife, who has deep connections to Yaizu
- Yakumo spent his later summers in Yaizu as a place of healing and inspiration, and he deeply loved the sea and town of Yaizu

**Recent Visit:**
- In March 2025, the lead actress Takaishi Akari visited Yaizu for a feature in the travel magazine "Tabiiro" (æ—…è‰²)
- During her visit, she explored sites connected to Yakumo, including the Yaizu Koizumi Yakumo Memorial Museum, and was particularly moved by letters Yakumo sent to Setsu from Yaizu

**Local Initiatives:**
The town of Yaizu has been actively promoting Yakumo-related tourism, including the development of special products and merchandise inspired by Yakumo's connection to the city.

If you'd like to know more about Yakumo's connection to Yaizu or visit related sites, feel free to ask!

Solo Traveler Interests in Yaizu City
content:
Excellent choice! Yaizu City is famous for its fresh seafood and local cuisine. Here are some great options for solo travelers:

**Yaizu Sakana Center (ç„¼æ´¥ã•ã‹ãªã‚»ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ¼)** is the heart of seafood in Yaizu. It's a large market and dining complex where you can:
- Browse fresh fish, dried goods, and local specialties
- Enjoy meals at multiple restaurants inside

**Popular restaurants at Sakana Center:**

1. **Sansui (ã•ã‚“ã™ã„)** - Specializes in fresh seafood bowls and sushi
   - Over 30 varieties of seafood donburi (rice bowls)
   - Fresh fish sourced daily from Yaizu Port
   - Website: https://www.sansui-yaizu.co.jp/index.html

2. **Sakana Daishokunado Nagisa (ã•ã‹ãªå¤§é£Ÿå ‚æ¸š)** - Large dining hall with 270 seats on the first floor
   - Perfect for solo diners
   - Fresh seafood dishes featuring local catches
   - Website: https://www.sakana-center.com/

3. **Tekka-ya (ã¦ã£ã‹å®¶)** - Direct from Sumaru Suisan fish market
   - Premium seafood donburi with exceptional tuna
   - Fresh local fish, shellfish, raw shirasu, and sakura shrimp
   - Website: https://tekka-ya.com/

**Local Specialties to Try:**
- **Bonito (Katsuo)** - Yaizu produces the nation's top bonito products
- **Bonito flakes & dried bonito** - Perfect souvenirs
- **Dried fish (Himono)** - Local favorite
- **Bonito heart (Katsuo no Heso)** - A unique local delicacy

**Wada Hama Beach (å’Œç”°æµœæµ·å²¸)** - A scenic coastal area with a well-maintained walking path, slopes, benches, and restrooms. Perfect for leisurely strolls and enjoying the sunset. Great choice! Renting a bike is a perfect way to explore Yaizu City. ğŸš´â€â™‚ï¸

Yaizu City offers convenient bike rentals through the Yaizu City Tourism Association. You can choose between regular bicycles (Â¥500/day) or electric-assist bicycles (Â¥800/day). A deposit of Â¥500 is required upfront and will be refunded after inspection when you return the bike.

**Rental Stations:**
The main rental station is at **Yaizu City Tourism Association** (ç„¼æ´¥å¸‚è¦³å…‰å”ä¼š), located right in front of JR Yaizu Station's south exit. There are also several other rental stations throughout the city including Yaizu Station North, Nishi-Yaizu Station, and partner shops.

**Operating Hours:**
9:00 AM â€“ 5:00 PM (Last rental at 4:00 PM)
*Yaizu Station North: 7:00â€“9:20 AM on weekdays, 7:00â€“8:20 AM on weekends/holidays

**What You Need:**
- Valid ID
- Your mobile phone number

**Included:**
- Free helmet rental
- Safety briefing

The terrain is mostly flat, making it easy for anyone to enjoy cycling. You can explore the harbor, visit fishing-related museums, enjoy fresh seafood, and take in views of Suruga Bay and Mount Fuji!

conversation_title: Solo Traveler Experience in Yaizu City
content:
Yaizu City offers several wonderful beaches perfect for solo travelers. Here are some highlights:

**Hamato Beach (æµœå½“ç›®æµ·æ°´æµ´å ´)** - Yaizu's only official swimming beach with calm waves, perfect for beginners and families. It features a 400-meter sandy beach with breakwaters about 50 meters offshore, keeping the waves gentle. The beach is open for swimming from mid-July to mid-August (10:00-16:00, until 17:00 on weekends and holidays). Free parking, showers, changing rooms, and restrooms are available. You can also enjoy beautiful sunrise and sunset views here. Access: 20-minute walk from JR Yaizu Station, or take the Yaizu Loop Bus to "Kokuzou-son Entrance" stop and walk 8 minutes.

**Wada Beach (å’Œç”°æµœæµ·å²¸)** - A scenic spot known for its spectacular views of Suruga Bay and Mount Fuji. The beach features a well-maintained walking path with slopes, benches, and restroomsâ€”perfect for leisurely strolls and relaxation. On clear days, you can see Mount Fuji's silhouette across the calm bay waters. The beach is also popular with anglers. Access: 15 minutes by car from JR Yaizu Station, or take the Shizutetsu Bus "Isshiki-Wadahama Line" for about 25 minutes to "Nishi-Matsubara Danchi Entrance" stop and walk 7 minutes.

Both beaches offer peaceful experiences and are ideal for solo travelers seeking natural beauty and relaxation.

Yaizu City offers several wonderful beaches and natural attractions perfect for solo travelers. Here are some highlights:

**æµœå½“ç›®æµ·æ°´æµ´å ´ (Hamatome Beach)** - Yaizu's only official swimming beach with calm waves, perfect for relaxation. It features a 400m sandy beach with breakwaters about 50m offshore, making it safe and family-friendly. The beach is open for swimming from mid-July to mid-August, with lifeguards on duty. You'll also find free parking, showers, changing rooms, and toilets. On clear days, you can see Mount Fuji across Suruga Bay.

**å’Œç”°æµœæµ·å²¸ (Wadahama Coast)** - A scenic coastal area known for stunning views of Suruga Bay and Mount Fuji. The coastline features a well-maintained walking path with slopes, benches, and restroomsâ€”perfect for leisurely strolls and sunset viewing. The pebbled beach is easy to walk on, and it's a popular spot for fishing (saba and tachi-uwo are common catches). It's also known as a sunrise viewing spot.

**çŸ³æ´¥æµœæµ·æµœå…¬åœ’ (Ishizu Hamakaihin Park)** - A coastal park with a protective pine forest (tsunami defense), popular with locals for walking and jogging. The park also features the Shizuoka Prefectural Yaizu Youth House, a facility for youth development and lifelong learning.

Each beach offers unique charmâ€”whether you're seeking swimming, scenic walks, photography, or peaceful nature time.

content:
Ah, you're interested in Koizumi Yakumo (å°æ³‰å…«é›²)! He was a famous writer who visited Yaizu City many times and loved this place. His connection to Yaizu is an important part of the city's cultural heritage.

The main attraction related to him is the **Yaizu Koizumi Yakumo Memorial Museum** (ç„¼æ´¥å°æ³‰å…«é›²è¨˜å¿µé¤¨). This museum displays items and artifacts connected to Yakumo, and tells the story of how he found Yaizu to be a place of healing and inspiration. The museum showcases his relationship with the local people and his deep affection for the city.

**Basic Information:**
- **Phone:** 054-620-0022
- **Address:** ã€’425-0071 Yaizu City, Shizuoka Prefecture, Mina 1550
- **Hours:** 9:00 AM â€“ 5:00 PM
- **Closed:** Every Monday (or the following weekday if Monday is a holiday), year-end/New Year period, and during exhibition changes
- **Parking:** Available
- **Accessibility:** Wheelchair accessible, accessible restrooms available
- **Website:** www.city.yaizu.lg.jp

There's also the **Yakumo Fuei no Chi Monument** (å…«é›²é¢¨è© ä¹‹åœ°ç¢‘), a memorial stone dedicated to Koizumi Yakumo, located about a 15-minute walk from JR Yaizu Station. It's part of the literary heritage trail in Yaizu.

Yaizu offers several romantic scenic viewpoints perfect for couples:

**Mankanho Peak (æº€è¦³å³°)** - A moderate hiking trail with 360-degree panoramic views of Mount Fuji, Suruga Bay, and the Izu Peninsula from the summit. The well-maintained trail takes about 2-3 hours round trip, and you can relax on benches while enjoying the views. Best visited in autumn through spring.

**Ookuzu Coast (å¤§å´©æµ·å²¸)** - A dramatic clifftop drive along a scenic "ocean road" with stunning views of Mount Fuji across Suruga Bay. This is a scenic spot featured in Shizuoka's top 10 landscapes, perfect for photos and romantic drives.

**Oigawa River Mouth Observation Deck (å¤§äº•å·æ²³å£å±•æœ›å°)** - Where the river meets the bay, offering views of Mount Fuji, the river, and the ocean all at once. Especially magical at sunset or on clear winter days when Mount Fuji's silhouette is crisp.

**Kojikoku Mountain (è™šç©ºè”µå±±)** - A gentle hike with views of Yaizu's harbor, Suruga Bay, and Mount Fuji on clear days. Perfect for a quick scenic escape with coastal walks nearby.

**Shironokoshi Wharf (åŸä¹‹è…°åŸ é ­)** - A fishing port viewpoint where you can see Mount Fuji framed by fishing boats and breakwatersâ€”excellent for atmospheric photos.

Excellent choice! Yaizu has a rich cultural and historical heritage. ğŸ›ï¸ Your group will find fascinating museums, historic sites, and traditional areas to explore.

Let me show you some wonderful options:

**ç„¼æ´¥å¸‚æ­´å²æ°‘ä¿—è³‡æ–™é¤¨ (Yaizu City History & Folklore Museum)**
Located in the Yaizu City Cultural Center, this museum showcases Yaizu's local history and folk culture through abundant exhibits. You'll find:
- Traditional household items and fishing-related artifacts
- Archaeological materials discovered locally
- **Special focus: Daigo Fukuryu Maru (Fifth Lucky Dragon) exhibits** â€” Learn about Yaizu's connection to nuclear history and its impact on the fishing industry
- Rotating exhibitions (3 times yearly) on topics like "Yaizu's Food Culture," "Traditional Tools," and "Historical Figures"
- Regular workshops and cultural lectures for visitors

**Access:** From JR Yaizu Station, take the Yaizu City Bus to "Bunka Center Mae" (Cultural Center), then 1-minute walk
**Hours:** 9:00 AM â€“ 5:00 PM | **Closed:** Mondays (or next weekday if Monday is a holiday), year-end/new year
**Admission:** Free

**ãªã‚“ã°ã‚“è¨˜å¿µé¤¨ (Nanban Memorial Museum)**
A museum dedicated to the history of Fukuichi Fishery and Yaizu's fishing culture. Exhibits include:
- Models and historical materials from the Edo period to present
- Traditional fishing tools and equipment
- Fishermen's daily life items and household goods
- Photographs and cultural heritage rooted in the local community

**Access:** About 13 minutes walk from Yaizu Station

- Main deity: Kannon Bodhisattva
- Features a wooden Jizo Bodhisattva statue (77 cm tall) carved by the renowned Edo-period sculptor Mokujiki â€” designated as a Yaizu City tangible cultural property
- Western Thirty-Three Kannon stone statues in the grounds
